timings.name: Study Treatment Administration After Insulin Stop

conditions.name: Treatment Success Criteria
conditions.description: Primary efficacy endpoint for treatment success
conditions.text: Plasma glucose increase of ≥20 mg/dL from baseline within 30 minutes of glucagon administration without additional rescue therapy

conditions.name: Hypoglycemia Induction Target
conditions.description: Target plasma glucose level for hypoglycemia induction

conditions.name: Admission PG Criteria
conditions.description: Plasma glucose level required for admission on Day 1
conditions.text: PG level is 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1

conditions.name: TE ADA Resolution Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for completing additional immunogenicity follow-up
conditions.text: Titer returns to baseline (within a single 2-fold dilution of the baseline titer)

conditions.name: Safety Review Criteria
conditions.description: Safety data review requirement before continuing enrollment
conditions.text: Safety data will be reviewed after the first 6 patients are administered LY900018 in Period 2

conditions.name: Evaluable Primary Outcome
conditions.text: At least 66 patients (at least 30 patients with T1DM and T2DM, respectively) complete both periods with evaluable primary outcome

transitionRules.name: Screening to Period 1 Transition
transitionRules.text: Patients will undergo a screening examination within 28 days prior to enrollment and be randomized to treatment sequence

transitionRules.name: Period 1 to Washout Transition
transitionRules.text: Patients complete Period 1 Day 1 procedures and may be discharged 6 hours after glucagon administration

transitionRules.name: Washout to Period 2 Transition
transitionRules.text: Periods 1 and 2 will be separated by a washout period of 3 to 14 days

transitionRules.name: Period 2 to Follow-up Transition
transitionRules.text: Patients will return for a follow-up visit 26 to 30 days after the last study treatment

transitionRules.name: Insulin Infusion Stop Trigger
transitionRules.text: Insulin infusion is stopped once bedside PG is <60 mg/dL

transitionRules.name: Admission Reschedule
transitionRules.text: Admission can be rescheduled if PG level is not 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Other Study Enrollment
transitionRules.text: Enrollment in any other clinical study involving an investigational product or enrollment in any other type of medical research judged not to be scientifically or medically compatible with this study

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Medical/Safety/Regulatory Reasons
transitionRules.text: Participation in the study needs to be stopped for medical, safety, regulatory, or other reasons consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and good clinical practice

transitionRules.name: Investigator Decision Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: The investigator decides that the patient should be discontinued from the study for any reason

transitionRules.name: Patient Decision Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: The patient, or legal representative, requests to be withdrawn from the study

transitionRules.name: TE ADA Additional Follow-up Trigger
transitionRules.text: Patients with TE ADA at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up every 12 weeks until titer returns to baseline or until 1 year after the last dose

transitionRules.name: Rescue Therapy for Insufficient Response
transitionRules.text: Procedures for Insufficient Response to Glucagon Administration

transitionRules.name: Inadvertently Enrolled Patient Continuation
transitionRules.text: If the sponsor or investigator identifies a patient who did not meet enrollment criteria and was inadvertently enrolled, a discussion must occur between the Lilly CP/CRP and the investigator to determine if the patient may continue in the study

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of both treatment periods and follow-up visit 26 to 30 days after the last study treatment

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Discontinuation - Other Study Enrollment
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Enrollment in any other clinical study involving an investigational product

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Discontinuation - Medical/Safety/Regulatory
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participation stopped for medical, safety, regulatory, or other reasons

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Discontinuation - Investigator Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Investigator decides patient should be discontinued for any reason

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Discontinuation - Patient Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient or legal representative requests withdrawal from the study

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Termination for Safety
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Following the review of the safety data from the first 6 patients to complete Period 2 Day 1, the study will be stopped if deemed necessary for patient safety

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Patient Replacement
scheduleTimelineExits.description: If patients discontinue from the study before completion of both periods with evaluable primary outcome for any reason, the patient may be replaced up to 75 patients enrolled

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Safety Review Decision Point
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Safety data review after first 6 patients complete Period 2 Day 1 to determine if remaining patients can be dosed

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Admission Eligibility Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to proceed with admission or reschedule based on PG level 90-250 mg/dL

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Insulin Infusion Stop Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to stop insulin infusion when bedside PG reaches <60 mg/dL

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Patient Discharge Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for patient discharge at least 6 hours after glucagon administration, may stay longer at investigator discretion

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: TE ADA Follow-up Continuation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to continue additional immunogenicity follow-up based on TE ADA status

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Inadvertent Enrollment Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision between Lilly CP/CRP and investigator on whether inadvertently enrolled patient may continue
